--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Steve Hultay" <urkel23@...> wrote:
>
> 
> I was in Radio Shack buying a couple batteries today for a couple 
of 
> watches and noticed a radio that supplied AM/FM and Shortwave that 
also 
> had an internal speaker.  I took a shot and brought it home and 
hacked 
> it in a matter of minutes and was willing to take a chance for the 
sake 
> of research.  Well it worked, it is model #20-125.  I took the 3 
screws 
> out minus the antenna screw and opened it up.  I took away the top 
> board and didn't see much and seen a lower board below it.  No 
screws, 
> they are held together by clips on the top and bottom of the 
board.  
> The bottom board once removed has markings and you will look for 
the MU 
> on the board.  The ribbon looks like a hardrive ribbon for a 
computer.  
> It has glue covering the wires that you have to move away, i used a 
> straight razor.  Once the wire is clean and able to be approached, 
cut 
> it with the same straight razor. Just the wire marked MU for Mute. 
> Close the unit up and your done. 
> 
> Hope this helps
> 
> Thanx,
> -Steve H.
>
